website_summaries.verdict: As AND 1 makes a huge come back in the world of basketball, it drops a splendid low-top basketball sneaker that surely catches everyone’s attention. The shoe is commended for its simple design and colorways backed by its comfort and durability. Some may have issues with its fit and materials, but there is just more to love in this $90 sneaker.
pros: The AND 1 Attack Low is applauded for its breathability
The majority claims that their feet are dry all game and even all day long
Most owners notice that the shoe breaks in quickly and nicely
After the break-in period, the shoe becomes comfortable
The same happens with the Jordan Why Not Zer0.2
One buyer really likes his AND 1 Attack Low Chinese Red/Super Foil that he also bought another pair in the White/Gum colorway
Several reviewers recommend these AND 1 basketball shoes for both indoor and outdoor use because of their durable and grippy rubber outsoles
Many users mention that the shoe model is a decent and great casual shoe for daily use
Wearers who prefer a snug fit advise other buyers to go true to size
Some observe that the Harmonix RX cushioning delivers a great deal of comfort
cons: According to a couple of users, these AND 1 basketball shoes are quite heavy
The shoe laces are hard to keep tied, complain a few ballers
There are a few that recommend the innovative 33rd Air Jordan basketball shoes for instant and secure lacing system
Some AND 1 Attack Low owners observe that the metal top lace hole dig into their ankles and cause blisters

customer_reviews.title: Need 1/2 larger
customer_reviews.text: I ordered and received this and1 attack after watched youtube review, it was very nice price when i order....but shoes are little bit toght for me, i need 1/2 bigger one. Some reviewer said right shoes width are little tighter than left...yes i felt same as him. It was little bit weird. Cushion rate is 3/5. Overally It is ok for this price. But I will return and order again 1/2 bigger one
customer_reviews.author: Young min Yang

customer_reviews.title: Narrow Toe Box
customer_reviews.text: A friend warned me they would be tight in the toes and even taking that into account they didn't fit. Hard to judge the width having gone a 1/2 size up, but I still think they were narrow. In the short time I tried them on I liked the cushion and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: scoon

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for the price! Retail is $80 and I got for $32! A bit snug near the toes but still a good fit. Materials are great and seems like they will wear well with time. Cushioning is good, not great like Bounce, Lightstrike, Micro G, or Zoom. I may try to hoop in them or just shoot around. Kids these days don’t know how big AND1 was back in the early 2000s. Good job with these AND1!
customer_reviews.author: CPTree

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice shoe, fits a little tight should have ordered 8 I/2's. Ill try and break them in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These would be great casual shoes I did not like playing in them
customer_reviews.text: The top lace hole is not covered by material and is bare metal. I wore thick socks and it still dug into my ankle. These would be great casual shoes I did not like playing in them,
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Rollins

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought a half size larger due to previous remarks and reviews. Glad I did because it fits correctly
customer_reviews.author: catherine cavallo

customer_reviews.title: Bought 11. 5. But got true to size ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought 11.5. But got true to size. I’m an 11.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander M.

customer_reviews.title: They ight
customer_reviews.text: They're ok nothing amazing the laces are hard to keep tied and it's a little heavy. Afterwards it's a decent shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jackprime

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: This white color way with the gum bottoms are clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jonavan

customer_reviews.title: And1 trying to up its ante!
customer_reviews.text: Actually got the red pair first because I remember And1 when they first came out. A little snug for my foot but was not so bad that I thought about it when I played in them. Liking this white pair with the gum bottom. Great pick up for the price (size 15s going for $30!).
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice budget pickup
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe for outdoors judging by just looking at the bottom, but I had to return these cuz it was a little too tight on the toe box. Whatever your basketball size is go up half a size, besides that the cushion is mediocre. For the price and the performance though I think it’s worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Elayda

product_meta.title: AND 1 Men's Attack Low Basketball Shoe
product_meta.description: New for spring/summer 2018, the attack low delivers a new performance last and the fit in a low-cut design, for the most aggressive player on the court. The subtle big cat heel motif will inspire you to hunt stats like a predator.
feature_bullets: Sleek micromesh upper with strategic substrate chopouts for lightweight breathability.
Nylon ghillie eyelets, attached to interior footbed, provide speedy and secure lockdown.
Injection molded shank for midfoot protection and stability.
Full length Harmonix RX cushioing inlayed with injected EVA. Robust tread pattern for indoor/outdoor versatility.
